intro: Sebastiania brasiliensis f. viridis, commonly known as the green-leaved sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms. It thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardens.
